name: bowdlerized
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
(of a book, play, film, etc.) having had words or parts that are considered unsuitable or offensive removed or changed: His account is neither a bowdlerized version of the past nor an invented one. Audiences only got to experience the work in its bowdlerised form. The novel was not published until 1950, and then in a heavily Bowdlerized version. Related word
bowdlerizeOpposite
unbowdlerized
More examplesFewer examplesDH Lawrence's novel was, at the time, banned in the US in all but a bowdlerised version.I never knew that "gee whiz" and "jeepers creepers" were bowdlerized versions of "Jesus".Still today, some school editions of Shakespeare are direct descendants of the Bowdlerised text.
